result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacquelyn A. Kroll

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
matter set for plea/sent 12/13/22 at 10:30

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:29 PM Defendant Jacquelyn A. Kroll appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jacquelyn A. Kroll. 
Court questions the defendant as to the waiver of the right to be present in person in court.
Court finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to appear in court. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacquelyn A. Kroll in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jacquelyn A. Kroll. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Initial Appearance set for May 31, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1
Portage County Justice Programs/Referral Form

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Do not possess/consume illegal drugs or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:21 PM Defendant Jacquelyn A Kroll appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jacquelyn A Kroll.

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Operating While Intoxicated - 4th offense, Failure to Install Ignition Interlock Device, Operating After Revocation. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments to the court.  Requests a signature bond.  Defendant is currently on a probation hold.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
